episodes.title: Word of Faith Member Verdict
episodes.description:
A judge found four Rutherford County church members not guilty on all charges. Word of Faith members Gilbert Carmona, Chris Hall, Jason Gross, and Randy Fields were accused of false imprisonment and stalking former member Jerry Cooper. The stalking charged was dropped and they were found not guilty of all other charges. However, an FBI agent was in the courtroom observing. He's looking into a separate abuse accusation involving church members.

_______________

episodes.title: Accusations Against Word of Faith Fellowship Members
episodes.description:
Members of a Rutherford County church face new accusations. Michael Lowry says Word of Faith Fellowship learned that he is gay. He says in August of 2011  he was assaulted on church grounds as he was read scripture because of his sexuality. Lowry filed a report with law enforcement but left town.  He's now back and pursuing the charges.  Jerry Cooper is a former member of the church and came back with Lowry. Both men say church members followed them when they learned they were back in town. The Word of Faith members have been charged with stalking. Word of Faith Fellowship responded in full by saying: "Concerning the allegations of Michael Roy Lowry, there is no truth in them. Knowing Michael very well, we believe he has been greatly influenced and persuaded to make these false allegations. The allegations made by Jerry Butcher (Cooper) are completely false.  He has made threats to destroy our church and the pastor. In February 2009 Jerry Butcher (Cooper) was convicted of Second Degree Trespass for disrupting our church service and refusing to leave. He was ordered by a district court judge at that time to not be found on or about the premises of Word of Faith Fellowship. He continues to contact us repeatedly through unwanted e-mails, harassing phone calls, text messages, and by driving about our church property
